column1: A blood culture is a laboratory test to check for bacteria or other microorganisms in a blood sample.
The site where blood will be drawn is first cleaned with an antiseptic such as chlorhexidine.
It is then watched to see if bacteria or other disease-causing organisms grow.
A gram stain is a method of identifying microorganisms (bacteria) using a special series of stains (colors).
Your doctor may order this test if you have symptoms of a serious blood infection (sepsis).
The blood culture helps identify the type of bacteria causing the infection.
